text: Indian equity benchmarks extended decline for the fourth day after a report that North Korea could respond to fresh sanctions with a hydrogen bomb in the Pacific triggered fresh bout of selling in Asian stocks.The S&P BSE Sensex fell as much as 0.9 percent to 32,072, while the NSE Nifty 50 declined as much as 1.1 percent to 10,011. All 19 sector gauges declined on the BSE Ltd led by the S&P BSE Metal Index’s 2 percent drop. The market breadth was firmly tilted in favour of sellers.
title: Stocks  Radar: A2Z Infra Engineering, KNR Constructions, Reliance Home Finance
